custom.usage:
import { App } from "@cloudcamp/aws-runtime";
const { App } = require("@cloudcamp/aws-runtime");
from cloudcamp.aws_runtime import App
using Cloudcamp.Aws.Runtime;
import cloudcamp.aws.runtime.App;

docs.remarks:
An app can be as big or small as you like - from a single webserver to dozens of load-balanced instances serving different parts of your application.

This example adds a WebServer to the production stack:

import { App, WebServer } from "@cloudcamp/aws-runtime";

let app = new App();

new WebServer(app.production, "prod-web", {
  dockerfile: "../Dockerfile"
});
const { App, WebServer } = require("@cloudcamp/aws-runtime");

let app = new App();

new WebServer(app.production, "prod-web", {
  dockerfile: "../Dockerfile"
});
from cloudcamp.aws_runtime import App, WebServer

app = App()

WebServer(app.production, "prod-web",
    dockerfile="../Dockerfile"
)
using Cloudcamp.Aws.Runtime;

App app = new App();

new WebServer(app.Production, "prod-web", new WebServerProps {
    Dockerfile = "../Dockerfile"
});
import cloudcamp.aws.runtime.App;
import cloudcamp.aws.runtime.WebServer;

App app = new App();

new WebServer(app.getProduction(), "prod-web", new WebServerProps.Builder()
        .dockerfile("../Dockerfile").build());
docs.summary: App represents your application running in the cloud. Every app contains one or more Stacks, which you can use to add your own resources, like a WebServer or a Database.

custom.remarks: App is a singleton class - it is instantiated exactly once, before any other resources are created.
custom.signature: new App()new App()new App()new App()new App()
static instance: Appstatic instancestatic instance: Appstatic App Instancestatic App getInstance()

docs.remarks: Throws an exception if App has not been instantiated yet.

custom.remarks: To deploy resources to the cloud, they are added to a Stack. CloudCamp comes with three default stacks:
custom.signature: network: Stacknetworknetwork: StackStack NetworkStack getNetwork()

docs.summary: Use this stack for anything related to the network, for example DNS entries.

custom.signature: pipeline: CdkPipelinepipelinepipeline: CdkPipelineCdkPipeline PipelineCdkPipeline getPipeline()
production: Stackproductionproduction: StackStack ProductionStack getProduction()
staging: Stackstagingstaging: StackStack StagingStack getStaging()

docs.summary: This stack can be used to create an environment for testing changes before deploying to production.

custom.signature: configuration: Configurationconfigurationconfiguration: ConfigurationConfiguration ConfigurationConfiguration getConfiguration()
addStack(name: string): StackaddStack(name)add_stack(name: str) -> StackStack AddStack(name: String)Stack addStack(String name)

docs.remarks:
Pass a stack name to create a new, empty stack:

const devStack = app.addStack("development");
const devStack = app.addStack("development");
dev_stack = app.add_stack("development")
Stack devStack = app.AddStack("development");
Stack devStack = app.addStack("development");
docs.summary: Add a new stack to your application.

custom.signature: addStage(name: string, stage?: Stage): StageaddStage(name, stage)add_stage(name: str, stage: Stage) -> StageStage AddStage(name: String, stage?: Stage)Stage addStage(String name, Stage stage)

docs.remarks:
This method can be used to add a stage with a custom Stack subclass.

import { App, WebServer, Stack } from "@cloudcamp/aws-runtime";

class CustomStack extends Stack {
   constructor(scope: cdk.Construct, id: string, props: cdk.StackProps) {
      super(scope, id, props);
      new WebServer(this, "web", {
        dockerfile: "../Dockerfile"
      });
   }
}

// later in the code...
const app = new App();
const stage = app.addStage("dev");
const stack = new CustomStack(stage, "dev");

// stack is automatically set to the new stack we created
if (stage.stack == stack) {
   // outputs "True!"
   console.log("True!");
}
const { App, WebServer, Stack } = require("@cloudcamp/aws-runtime");

class CustomStack extends Stack {
   constructor(scope: cdk.Construct, id: string, props: cdk.StackProps) {
      super(scope, id, props);
      new WebServer(this, "web", {
        dockerfile: "../Dockerfile"
      });
   }
}

// later in the code...
const app = new App();
const stage = app.addStage("dev");
const stack = new CustomStack(stage, "dev");

// stack is automatically set to the new stack we created
if (stage.stack == stack) {
   // outputs "True!"
   console.log("True!");
}
from cloudcamp.aws_runtime import App, WebServer, Stack

class CustomStack(Stack):
    def __init__(self, scope, id, props):
        super().__init__(scope, id, props)
        WebServer(self, "web",
            dockerfile="../Dockerfile"
        )

# later in the code...
app = App()
stage = app.add_stage("dev")
stack = CustomStack(stage, "dev")

# stack is automatically set to the new stack we created
if stage.stack == stack:
    # outputs "True!"
    print("True!")
using Cloudcamp.Aws.Runtime;

class CustomStack : Stack
{
    public MyClass(cdk.Construct scope, string id, cdk.StackProps props) : base(scope, id, props)
    {
        new WebServer(this, "web", new WebServerProps {
            Dockerfile = "../Dockerfile"
        });
    }
}

// later in the code...
App app = new App();
Stage stage = app.AddStage("dev");
CustomStack stack = new CustomStack(stage, "dev");

// stack is automatically set to the new stack we created
if (stage.Stack == stack)
{
    // outputs "True!"
    Console.WriteLine("True!");
}
import cloudcamp.aws.runtime.App;
import cloudcamp.aws.runtime.WebServer;
import cloudcamp.aws.runtime.Stack;

public class CustomStack extends Stack {
    public CustomStack(Construct scope, String id, StackProps props) {
        super(scope, id, props);
        new WebServer(this, "web", new WebServerProps.Builder()
                .dockerfile("../Dockerfile").build());
    }
}

// later in the code...
App app = new App();
Stage stage = app.addStage("dev");
CustomStack stack = new CustomStack(stage, "dev");

// stack is automatically set to the new stack we created
if (stage.getStack() == stack) {
    // outputs "True!"
    System.out.println("True!");
}

custom.remarks: In addition to the default stacks provided by cloudcamp, you can create your own stacks.
custom.signature: getStack(name: string): StackgetStack(name)get_stack(name: str) -> StackStack GetStack(name: String)Stack getStack(String name)

custom.remarks: Stages are responsible for building your stacks. By default, CloudCamp creates a stage for each stack and gives it the same name. You can customize this behaviour by adding your own stages.
custom.signature: getStage(name: string): StagegetStage(name)get_stage(name: str) -> StageStage GetStage(name: String)Stage getStage(String name)

docs.remarks:
Stages can be obtained by their name to modify their attributes. A common use case is to require manual approval to deploy to the production stage:

const stage = app.getStage("production");
stage.needsManualApproval = true;
const stage = app.getStage("production");
stage.needsManualApproval = true;
stage = app.get_stage("production")
stage.needs_manual_approval = True
var stage = app.GetStage("production");
stage.NeedsManualApproval = true;
Stage stage = app.getStage("production");
stage.setNeedsManualApproval(true);

custom.signature: synth(options?: StageSynthesisOptions): CloudAssemblysynth(options)synth(options: StageSynthesisOptions) -> CloudAssemblyCloudAssembly Synth(options?: StageSynthesisOptions)CloudAssembly synth(StageSynthesisOptions options)

docs.remarks: Once an assembly has been synthesized, it cannot be modified. Subsequent calls will return the same assembly.
docs.summary: Synthesize this stage into a cloud assembly.
